defaultPosition.description: Taylor Diving Services (TDS) is a professional commercial diving company that is veteran owned and family operated, which specializes in potable water storage facility maintenance.  TDS inspects, cleans and repairs drinking water storage facilities while in service.  Our primary service is potable water storage systems, although we also provide regular commercial diving services as needed.  Utilizing our specially trained commercial divers we can service your storage tank without draining.  Servicing your facility, while in operation, saves you money, time and eliminates the hassles associated with storage facilities that are out of service.
defaultPosition.title: Owner

positions.title: Owner

positions.description: Serves as a Management and Program Analyst for the Quality Assurance/Accountability/ Information Technology Branch (QA/IT) of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), Office of Human Capital (OHC) in Dallas, Texas.  Take proactive approaches to ensure quality assurance and quality control requirements are fulfilled throughout OHC Dallas.  Develops management information reports and spearhead projects on a recurring and ad hoc basis for internal and external customers.  Conduct reviews as well as monitors and manages system performance to ensure ICE systems meet user needs and accreditation requirements. Ensures required DHS mandatory training requirements are met. Serves as a primary point of contact on all audits by collaborating with all Divisions to include OHC Laguna to ensure audit requirements are met. Assist in collaboration and coordination with HQ & Laguna on Performance Based Awards to produce rating templates and instructions to facilitate ICE wide collection. Accurately process performance ratings in excess of 9,000 annually by conducting quality reviews and validating based on established OHC guidance. Conduct troubleshooting to enhance ICEâs program offices IT operational needs. Provide management information support to CBP/DHS. Participate in the KPMG Financial Audit, A-123 Audit, A-123 IT Audit, and the Improper Payments Elimination and Recovery Act (IPERA) Audit.  Was the project lead for first ever ICE One-Stop pre-employment expedited hiring event with a budget of $1.5 million dollars.  The highly successful hiring event was conducted to shorten the time frame from approximately 36 weeks to 14 days for the pre-employment medical exam, fitness test and drug testing process for the Deportation Office (DO) position and Criminal Investigators. Coordinated with the medical contractor to ensure all necessary equipment would be available to conduct approximately 50 medical, drug and fitness each day at each location.
positions.title: Management and Program Analyst
